Articles.Content:
yea i messed up some file naming and parts are missing I didn't notice.

FASA\Gemini2\FASA_Gemini_NoseCone2

in the cfg's the model definition should read

MODEL
{
  model = FASA/Gemini2/FASA_Gemini_NoseCone2/GeminiNoseconeCap
}

I will re-Upload it as well you dont feel like editing the files, takes about 30 min to upload...

Edited December 21, 2013 by frizzank
New downloads are up, should work correctly now.
ninja me one more time frizz, and I'm taking your coffee away.
Damn frizzank. You continue to amaze me with your work. I honestly can't wait for what is next!
Your models are fantastic. Have you thought about doing the Apollo CSM?

It is happening with the command module of the game, if I remember correctly MK1 his name, and only when using your mod, makes the game unstable. If I remove the mod, I can use the MK1 without problems, but when I use the MOD and use the MK1 the game is unstable and may crash at any time. Never happened to me before. I do not know if the problem is only mine, caused by a conflict with other mods or not. I love the mod you've done, is one of my favorites and I consider essential.
I must mention something.The Rescue G docking cap isn't showing up for me...I'll re-download it and hope for the best.
Adding a little extra like the MOL is definitely a nice made-up addition.

Adding a little extra like the MOL is definitely a nice made-up addition.

Its not made up, its a concept from the Gemini program, and would have been used had Gemini continued

Well, not quite. It was a USAF plan for a manned reconnaissance station, and would have been serviced by Blue Gemini ("Blue" means USAF version, like Blue Scout). Its only relation to NASA's Gemini program was that it used the Blue Gemini derivative; it lived or died apart from Gemini. It was also basically without purpose after robotic recon satellites proved to be more than capable enough, especially the plans for the non-film-bucket ones.

Frizzank: Agena! Woot! Loving it.

Any chance of doing British spacecraft? Namely Skylon, the Ariel satellites, Black Arrow/Prospero X-3, Skynet (yes its real), Zircon, Blue Streak, Black Prince, Falstaff, HOTOL, Beagle 2, SpaceShip One and Two?

Even as a seperate pack I would be one of (if not the) first to get it

kommitz is working on some of that.

Also, http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25136-Black-Arrow-British-satellite-launcher

kommitz is working on some of that.

Also, http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25136-Black-Arrow-British-satellite-launcher

Thanks :-)
I'd rather see Baby Sergeant motor and Explorer 1. Together with Juno I/Jupiter-C fairing set. Juno I was the first American rocket to actually make orbit, and Explorer I was it's payload.
And you already have Jupiter-C (aka MRLV) already made, so...

Well, not exactly. He's only got the 1st stage made (Redstone). Jupiter-C had 3 stages, Juno I had 4. In both cases, the 2nd stage consisted of 11 Baby Sergeant motors and the 3rd one of 3 Baby Sergeants. In case of Juno I, it had one more Baby Sergeant on the very top.

Sorry, thought that was obvious from you saying we still needed baby Sergeants, that I meant we had the Jupiter-C core stage (stretched Redstone). We definitely need the tub, the Sergeants, and the fairings.

(We actually discussed this upthread IIRC, how to model the tub)

Fasa is going to stay in nasa up untill 1976 other mods can take up the slack for the rest.

I also like doing the what could have been tech that never was. I think its much more enjoyable than doing strait copies of pure historical craft.

I also want to fix the gemini rocket pack and include more realistic one along with the kerbilized one that's in there now. Aka solid rocet retro in the proper section.

Edited December 22, 2013 by frizzank

I also want to fix the gemini rocket pack and include more realistic one along with the kerbilized one that's in there now. Aka solid rocet retro in the proper section.

<3

I haven't forgotten about Centaur and all that other stuff BTW; I was planning to get started right about when .23 hit
Does "the tech that could have been" apply to nothing after 1976?

The new extendable antenna on the nosecone is supposed to be the stuff we send things back to Kerbin with right? Because when I use it, it says there are no Comms on the ship. The cfg also has no antenna module in it, only the animation. If this is supposed to be the new antenna, maybe the old one can be retextured and resized to fit the MOL. While we're talking antennas, I'm missing one for the Mercury capsule. A picture of it was posted a few threads back. About the only thing Mercury still needs at this point.

And if you're ever out of ideas for pre-1976 projects to tackle Frizzank, the Apollo program is a treasure chest of both iconic historical designs and fanciful plans. Below are links with some of those crazy plans (interesting read for everyone):

http://nassp.sourceforge.net/wiki/Future_Expansion

and some of the various Saturn designs:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Saturn_(rocket_family)

Edited December 22, 2013 by CaptRobau
Nope, the "antenna" is a guide for Agena docking.
Then I must've downloaded a slightly corrupted file, because the normal antenna wasn't loading.

The new extendable antenna on the nosecone is supposed to be the stuff we send things back to Kerbin with right? Because when I use it, it says there are no Comms on the ship. The cfg also has no antenna module in it, only the animation. If this is supposed to be the new antenna, maybe the old one can be retextured and resized to fit the MOL. While we're talking antennas, I'm missing one for the Mercury capsule. A picture of it was posted a few threads back. About the only thing Mercury still needs at this point.

And if you're ever out of ideas for pre-1976 projects to tackle Frizzank, the Apollo program is a treasure chest of both iconic historical designs and fanciful plans. Below are links with some of those crazy plans (interesting read for everyone):

http://nassp.sourceforge.net/wiki/Future_Expansion

and some of the various Saturn designs:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Saturn_(rocket_family)

May I say Sir that why in the name of all that is holy did they not get the funding for all these? I mean, combining a Space Shuttle with a Saturn V? Thats genius

http://uncyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/British_Moon-landing

Ooh if someone actually did this for KSP (frizzank would do an awesome job hint hint) it would be awesome and funny as hell
